channel.title: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?
channel.description:
I wasn't thinking about a budget until I started talking with a friend. A $350 budget seems pretty low for you guys I bet. I'm just trying to build a computer that has the ability to run multiple programs such as 3D modeling software, IDEs, and maybe a game or two at the same time. I don't have this money at all...I'm not even close, but it's still possible.
AMD Duel Core Processor 3.60GHz - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/amd-a6-series-dual-core-a6-5400k-3-6ghz-desktop-edition-processor/1305769791.p?id=mp1305769791&skuId=1305769791&st=amd%20duel%20core%20processor&cp=1&lp=5#tab=buyingOptions]HERE[/url]
AMD Motherboard A78 Chipset - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/msi-desktop-motherboard-amd-a78-chipset-socket-fm2-/1310052642.p?id=mp1310052642&skuId=1310052642&st=amd%20motherboard%20FM2+%20a78%20chipset&cp=1&lp=1#tab=buyingOptions]HERE[/url]
Thermaltake V3 AMD Computer Case - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/thermaltake-v3-amd-edition-system-cabinet-black/1306183398.p?id=mp1306183398&skuId=1306183398&st=amd%20computer%20case&cp=1&lp=5#tab=buyingOptions]HERE[/url] or [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/rosewill-computer-case-black/1309529896.p?id=mp1309529896&skuId=1309529896&st=computer%20case&cp=1&lp=1#tab=buyingOptions]Rosewill - Computer Case[/url]
DDR3 SDRAM DIMM 4GB Memory - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/amd-radeon-entertainment-series-4gb-ddr3-sdram-dimm-desktop-memory/3026713.p?id=1219086171066&skuId=3026713&st=ddr3%20sdram%204gb&cp=1&lp=2]HERE[/url]
Seagate 1TB Internal Hard Drive - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/seagate-1tb-internal-serial-ata-hard-drive-for-desktops/8490625.p?id=1186003683968&skuId=8490625&st=internal%20hard%20drive&cp=1&lp=2]HERE[/url]
Thermaltake 430W Power Supply - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/thermaltake-430w-tr2-atx-power-supply/9827301.p?id=1218179698427&skuId=9827301&st=power%20supply&cp=1&lp=4]HERE[/url]
Oh yeah -> question: what do you think about all of this, or how could it be improved without jacking up the price?

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

lel you could buy a console and a chromebook for $350 or another cheap toy.

That would be a horrible decision.

Gaming would not be that good anyway on the requirements and also have you heard of steamOS?
[/quote]Only steam games?[/quote]Last I checked even steam os was lacking the ability to play most games.

item.title: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Ashi:

From what you said you’ll be using it for. The only reason this is acceptable is if you’re using Linux. You’ll happily be able to model, program and play games.

I’ve never used Linux, but I see a lot of people talk “Big” about it. I wouldn’t mind switching to Mac though, I love the looks, the speed, and the ability to have windows run on mac using THIS.
[hr]I just looked up some things between Macintosh, Windows 7 & 8, and Linux. So far, Linux beats them all in speed and it’s way easier to hack into Linux system for personal adjustments and modifications.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?

item.title: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?

item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Pure_:

dat cpu bottleneck

The A-Series APU performs surprisingly well. For the longest time i had an a4-3400 which is 2.7Ghz dual core and it could handle bf3 once I had a dedicated GPU.

item.title: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It all depends on what you are doing. I think I read somewhere that Intel performs better in single-threaded tasks whereas AMD does better with multi-threading. So then it comes down to is the application you’re using properly optimized for multiple cores? Probably not but who cares. The difference is negligible and being a fan boy is just hurting everyone else.

@OP: The AMD APUs are nice budget processors. You may want to upgrade in the future so see if you can justify spending a little bit more on something that uses the latest socket. It will guarantee a little bit of future proofing. I’m also not sure if 430 watts would reliably run a dedicated gpu at full power so do a little research now and see if you can upgrade that to save the hassle.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this computer build good for a $350 budget?

Your first mistake was AMD.

I personally go for a i3 at budget and save up for a fancy gpu.
[/quote]rofl go back to school kid

If it’s not Intel, it’s shit. K?[/quote]My AMD is holding up perfectly, and it was budget as fuck.

Read full topic
